title: COVID-19 Vaccines
description: COVID-19 vaccination sites in Houston, Texas.
cleaned_text: Page last reviewed: September 11, 2023 COVID-19 Vaccines Make sure you are [up to date](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/stay-up-to-date.html) on your COVID-19 vaccines by getting all recommended doses, including a booster when eligible. Vaccination helps protect you from [ serious illness, hospitalization, and death](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/effectiveness/work.html); it also helps reduce spread. In addition to HHD sites, vaccination is available at doctors' offices, pharmacies, and clinics. Find vaccines near you at [vaccines.gov](https://www.vaccines.gov/). In-Home Vaccination Free COVID-19 vaccination in your home is available to qualifying older adults, people with disabilities, and veterans. Call [832-393-4301](tel:+1-832-393-4301) to see if you qualify. Transportation Help - Area Agency on Aging: [832-393-4301](tel:+1-832-393-4301) - Aging & Disability - Lyft: [Via app](https://www.lyft.com/blog/posts/vaccines-for-all-announcing-free-rides-for-anyone-getting-a-shot) Fixed Vaccinations Sites Our fixed sites across Houston offer any dose of Moderna (age 6 months+), Pfizer (age 6 months+) and Novavax (age 12+) vaccines for all eligible ages. Health center and multi-service center vaccination sites accept walk-ups without appointments.
